section.p: If you want creates modules, you must read the morla-module.h and this little test.
Another important stuff is the config file. With the config file you can set the list of modules and the default module for the opening/saving/viewing procedures.

This is an example of the config file:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<morla_modules> <module>morla_test</module> <!-- <module default_open="yes">morla_test</module> --> <!-- <module default_save="yes">morla_test</module> --> <!-- <module default_open="yes" default_save="yes">morla_test</module> --> </morla_modules>
This file in a GNU/Linux/*BSD OS is into ${prefix}/lib/morla (e.g.: /usr/lib/morla/index.xml) and in a Windows OS: ${app}/modules (e.g.: C:\Program Files\Morla\modules\index.xml)
